What security standard is used for authenticating a user and for communication with our Identity Provider?

For communication (and hence for authentication of a user) with our IdP the OpenID Connect standard is used. A detailed explanation can be found here:

https://openid.net/connect/

The current solution uses the implicit flow (portals) and the code flow (EFS Admin) - see Flows

Where is Identity Data stored?

Identity Data is stored at Okta. Okta is using AWS cloud services to host their Identity solution. Other services might also be involved - also see Legal

Okta offers an EU cell for European companies. Data will be stored in Europe (information from Okta is that data is stored in Germany and Ireland) - also see https://www.okta.com/press-room/press-releases/okta-cements-its-commitment-to-emea-market-announces-eu-data-centre/

Okta will store first name, last name and email address as well as possibly password and MFA details like a phone number of a user (this might change in future).

Identity data is still stored in the respective applications like EFS and Portals.

How is security handled by Okta (our Identity Provider)?

Okta provides documentation about security related topics and certifications.

see https://www.okta.com/security/

How is data transfer between the EFS installation (EFS-Admin, Portals) and our Identity Provider secured?

Data transferred from EFS to our Identity Provider will take place using the HTTPS protocol. An API token mechanism will be used to authorize requests to our Identity Provider.

Data transfer from our Identity Provider will also be secured using the HTTPS protocol. Communication in that direction will take place in the boundaries of OpenID Connect.

How is data transfer between our Identity Provider and the client’s Identity Provider secured?

In the case of the communication with a client’s Identity Provider both sides have to technically take care of securing the communication. Our Identity Provider offers communication via HTTPS. During setup of the client’s Identity Provider we have to take care, that the communication fits our security needs.

Is the Identity Provider always available?

Our Identity Provider guarantees availability of 99.9%. The documentation can be found here.

https://www.okta.com/a-secure-reliable-service-you-can-trust/

Is there a security monitoring in our Identity Provider? Who is in charge of performing it?

What are the session (and token) lifetimes?

The session times can be found in the section sessions - see Sessions

A more detailed explanation of the difference between the sessions can be found in Sessions Explained

I previously used the high security mode in EFS - can I use that feature with IAM SSO?

The High security mode focuses on password policies, retry and lock processes and multi-factor authentication as well as ACLs, sessions and cookies.

Especially password-policies, multi-factor authentication, sessions and retry/lock processes do not effect the solution anymore when SSO is active. Hence most of the features in high-security mode might be irrelevant.

also see MFA (Multi-Factor-Authentication) and Password Policy

How will a password reset happen?

see: Tivian Access with EFS and Portals

Are there rules for password strength and password retention policy?

see: Tivian Access with EFS and Portals

Is MFA supported?

Yes.

see MFA (Multi-Factor-Authentication)

If a user logs in at our Identity Provider, will the user be able to login every Tivian application?

No. There is a difference between the authentication (who am I?) and the authorization/access (what am I allowed to do?) in the current solution. The Identity Provider will only verify that an identity belongs to the respective user. The access right for that specific user are still managed by every Application.

Hence every user that logs in at our Identity Provider can tell every Tivian application their respective identity but will not be able to access every application.

If we connect our solution to the customer's Identity Povider, how will security take place at this Identity Provider?

The customer’s Identity Provider belongs to the customer. Therefore we do not have (and we should never have) any access to that provider changing anything. Security on the side of the Identity Provider is fully Managed by the customer.

How will I be able to manage access to applications in our Identity Provider?

see above.

The Identity Provider will not manage any access policies for now. It will only verify a user’s identity. Also see Access and Authorization with IAM module

My users got an e-mail to activate their account and to set a passwort from Okta but they use their own Identity Provider - What password is correct?

The password the user provided at Okta will be stored at Okta.

The user should never be asked for that password if this user is an Identity Provider user.

But in that case either the configuration in EFS or Okta are not correct.

see Okta tenant setup and SAML Provider Setup and EFS Admin Configuration OLD

My EFS installation is currently using HTTP (without HTTPS) - is it possible to enable Tivian Access in that case?

Using HTTP is not secure. Therefore it is prohibited use Tivian Access with HTTP. There are no guarantees in such a careless use case.

Before using Tivian Access HTTPS has to be enabled for every product making use of Tivian Access.

With Chrome in version 80+ third-party cookies without the same-site attribute are not allowed anymore - is that an issue? I can see warnings in Chrome’s developer console for the Okta login flow - does that effect functionality?

Okta has taken care to update all relevant Cookies. The warnings in Chrome’s developer console stem from Cookies that are not affected. They are not sent to the server and therefore not critical.

We hope that Okta will update their libraries to get rid of the warning. But no functionality should be affected.

Also see:

https://devforum.okta.com/t/errors-in-chrome-with-samesite-using-okta-auth-js/7373/5

https://developer.okta.com/docs/release-notes/2019-10-0/#tokens-transform-events-no-longer-available
